title: How to Print Text Messages from an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Messages.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Messages. Tap the Messages app icon, which resembles a white speech bubble on a green background. If your text messages are already saved as screenshots, you can skip this step.

steps.title: Select a conversation.
steps.content: Select a conversation. Find the conversation that contains the text messages you want to print, then tap the conversation to open it.

steps.title: Scroll to the section you want to print.
steps.content: Scroll to the section you want to print. Scroll up until you find the part you want to screenshot.

steps.title: Display timestamps if necessary.
steps.content: Display timestamps if necessary. If you need to display the timestamps next to each message (e.g., if you're saving the conversations as legal evidence), tap and drag from right to left across the screen. Keep in mind that you'll have to hold the screen there while screenshotting.

steps.title: Take a screenshot.
steps.content: Take a screenshot. Depending on your iPhone model, do one of the following: iPhone 8 and down — Press the Home and Power buttons at the same time. iPhone X — Press the Power and Volume Up buttons at the same time.

steps.title: Repeat for any other needed sections of the conversation.
steps.content: Repeat for any other needed sections of the conversation. Once you've taken a screenshot of every part of the conversation you need, you can proceed with printing your screenshots.

steps.title: Make sure you're on the correct Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Make sure you're on the correct Wi-Fi network. If you're using an AirPrint printer with your iPhone, your iPhone must be on the same Wi-Fi network as the printer. [1] X Research source You can connect to the correct Wi-Fi network if necessary before proceeding.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Photos.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Photos. Tap the Photos app icon, which resembles a multicolored pinwheel on a white background.

steps.title: Tap the Albums tab.
steps.content: Tap the Albums tab. It's at the bottom of the screen. If Photos loads to a photo, tap the "Back" button in the top-left corner of the screen before proceeding.

steps.title: Scroll down to the "Media Types" heading.
steps.content: Scroll down to the "Media Types" heading. You'll find this about halfway down the Albums page.

steps.title: Tap Screenshots.
steps.content: Tap Screenshots . It's under the "Media Types" heading. Doing so brings up a list of all of your screenshots.

steps.title: Tap Select.
steps.content: Tap Select . This is in the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Select your screenshots.
steps.content: Select your screenshots. Tap each screenshot you want to print to do so.

steps.title: Tap the "Share" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Share" icon. It's in the bottom-left corner of the screen. A pop-up menu will appear at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Print.
steps.content: Tap Print . This printer-shaped icon is in the pop-up menu. Doing so brings up the "Print" menu.

steps.title: Set up your printer preferences.
steps.content: Set up your printer preferences. You can select your printer and the number of copies you want to print from here: Printer — Tap the Printer text field, then select your AirPrint printer if it isn't already selected. Number of copies — Tap + to increase the number of copies you want to print, or tap - to decrease the number of copies.

steps.title: Tap Print.
steps.content: Tap Print . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. Your iPhone's screenshots will begin printing.

steps.title: Download the screenshots onto your computer
steps.content: Download the screenshots onto your computer . You can use your iPhone's USB cable and your computer's Photos app to import the screenshots you just took.

steps.title: Connect your computer to a printer
steps.content: Connect your computer to a printer . If your computer isn't already connected to the printer you want to use, connect it before proceeding.

steps.title: Open the photos' folder.
steps.content: Open the photos' folder. Depending on your computer, you'll do one of the following: Windows — Open File Explorer , click Pictures on the left side of the window, and double-click the folder that was created when you downloaded the photos from your iPhone. Mac — Open the Photos app and scroll to the screenshots.

steps.title: Select the photos you want to print.
steps.content: Select the photos you want to print. On Windows, you can click one photo in the folder and then press Ctrl + A to select all of the photos in the folder. On a Mac, hold down ⌘ Command while clicking each file you want to print.

steps.title: Open the "Print" menu.
steps.content: Open the "Print" menu. This step varies depending on your computer: Windows — Right-click a selected file, then click Print in the resulting drop-down menu. Mac — Click the File menu item at the top of the screen, then click Print in the resulting drop-down menu.

steps.title: Confirm your printer preferences.
steps.content: Confirm your printer preferences. Printer menus will vary depending on your computer and your printer, but you'll usually have the option to do the following: Select a printer from the "Printer" drop-down box at the top of the menu. Select a format for your images in the middle of the menu. Select a number of copies. Select a color preference if present.

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . It's usually at the bottom of the Print menu. Doing so prompts your screenshots to begin printing.
